title: EPIC: Core Agentic Platform Infrastructure
body:
Goal: Establish the foundational backend, database, and configuration needed to run multi-agent workflows and integrate with GitHub and MCP tools.

Acceptance criteria:
- Backend service running locally with health check endpoint
- Database created with migrations and basic schemas for Projects, Agents, Runs, and Integrations
- Configuration system for secrets (GitHub token, model keys, MCP endpoints)
- Basic logging and error handling in place

title: STORY: Define project and workspace domain models
body:
As a user, I want to create and manage projects/workspaces so that agents can operate on a specific idea, repo, and configuration.

Acceptance criteria:
- DB models for Project/Workspace with fields: name, description, repo URL, default stack, status
- CRUD API (create, update, list, archive)
- Seed script to create one demo project
- Unit tests for model and API validation

title: STORY: Implement MCP configuration and client layer
body:
As a developer, I want a unified MCP client layer so agents can call tools (GitHub, filesystem, TypeScript, test runner) through a standard protocol instead of custom integrations.

Acceptance criteria:
- Config model for MCP servers (name, command, args, env, allowed resources)
- Code to invoke MCP tools via JSON-RPC with error handling
- Basic health check for at least one server (e.g., filesystem or GitHub)
- Logging of each tool call (agent, tool, duration, result)

title: STORY: Integrate GitHub issues and repos via MCP tools
body:
As a PM/Scrum agent, I want to create and update GitHub issues and read repo metadata via MCP instead of calling the GitHub API directly.

Acceptance criteria:
- MCP server entry for GitHub with token-based auth
- Utility functions for: list repos, list/create/update issues, apply labels, link milestones
- Config option to associate a Project with a GitHub repo
- Simple CLI or API endpoint to create a test issue from the platform

title: EPIC: Multi-Agent Orchestrator Core
body:
Goal: Create an orchestrator that coordinates PM, Scrum, Architect, Dev, QA, and DevOps agents and controls their use of MCP tools.

Acceptance criteria:
- Agent registry with roles, capabilities, and allowed tools
- Orchestration engine with simple state machine (idea → requirements → issues → code → tests)
- Persistence of runs with status and logs
- Minimal API to start an orchestration run for a project

title: STORY: Implement Product Manager agent (requirements & epics)
body:
As a Product Manager agent, I want to take a free-form idea and generate a product brief, themes, and initial epics so that downstream agents can plan and implement.

Acceptance criteria:
- Agent implementation that accepts: idea, constraints, target stack
- Output schema: product brief, user personas, problem statements, feature themes, suggested epics
- Orchestrator step: Run PM agent for project and save results in DB
- At least one example run stored and viewable via API

title: STORY: Implement Scrum Master agent for epics and user stories
body:
As a Scrum Master agent, I want to convert epics into user stories and GitHub-ready issues with acceptance criteria and labels so the dev agents can work autonomously.

Acceptance criteria:
- Input: epics and product brief from PM agent
- Output: list of stories and tasks with fields: title, body, labels, estimate, dependencies
- GitHub issue creation through the GitHub MCP tool
- Status and logs stored per planning run

title: STORY: Implement Developer agent with MCP filesystem and language tools
body:
As a Developer agent, I want to read and modify code through MCP filesystem and language servers so that I can implement issues safely with validation.

Acceptance criteria:
- Agent that takes a single issue (with context) and proposed file edit plan
- Uses MCP filesystem server to read/write files under a project root
- Uses MCP language/TypeScript server (or similar) to get diagnostics for changes
- Writes a summary of edits and test commands executed

title: STORY: Implement QA agent and test runner MCP tool
body:
As a QA agent, I want to run test suites via an MCP test runner tool so I can validate changes made by developer agents and open bug issues when tests fail.

Acceptance criteria:
- MCP server or tool definition for running tests (e.g., npm test or framework-specific)
- Agent that triggers tests after a dev agent run and parses results (pass/fail, coverage if available)
- Automatic creation of a GitHub bug issue when tests fail (title, repro steps, logs)
- Status recorded on the orchestration run

title: EPIC: Web UI shell for projects, agents, and runs
body:
Goal: Provide a modern, responsive UI for managing projects, viewing agent activity, and tracking orchestration runs.

Acceptance criteria:
- Layout with sidebar (Projects, Agents, Runs) and main content area
- Project detail page showing idea, brief, epics, and issues
- Run detail page showing timeline of steps (PM → Scrum → Dev → QA)
- Basic auth and session management in place

title: STORY: Visualize agent runs and MCP tool calls
body:
As a user, I want to see a timeline of which agents ran, what tools they called, and what artifacts they produced so I can understand and trust the automation.

Acceptance criteria:
- UI component that lists steps with timestamps, agent name, and status
- Clicking a step shows tool calls, sanitized inputs, and outputs/links (e.g., GitHub issue, commit)
- Filter by agent type and status (success, failed, skipped)

title: STORY: Provide MCP config templates for IDEs (Windsurf/Cursor/etc.)
body:
As a developer, I want ready-to-use MCP config snippets so I can connect my IDE to the same MCP servers used by the platform.

Acceptance criteria:
- Example MCP config files for at least one IDE (e.g., Windsurf) checked into the repo
- Docs page describing how to point IDE MCP clients at project MCP servers
- One sample workflow: open project in IDE, call implement issue #X via IDE agent using the same tools

title: STORY: Create initial automation workflow for project creation
body:
As an operator, I want a reusable automation workflow so creating a new project can trigger generation of epics, issues, and initial agent runs automatically.

Acceptance criteria:
- Basic workflow definition (e.g., JSON or YAML) for on project_created → call PM → Scrum → GitHub issues
- Stored under an automation or n8n-workflows directory in the repo
- README section explaining how to import/use the workflow

title: STORY: Document agent roles and MCP architecture
body:
As a contributor, I want clear docs describing each agent, the orchestrator, and the MCP tool layer so I can extend the system safely.

Acceptance criteria:
- Architecture page explaining host ↔ MCP client ↔ MCP server pattern
- Agent reference: PM, Scrum, Architect, Dev, QA, DevOps and their allowed tools
- Sequence diagram (e.g., Mermaid) for a typical idea → deployed code flow

title: TASK: Add GitHub issue templates (Epic, Story, Task, Bug)
body:
Create standardized issue templates so new issues are consistent with the agentic planning model.

Acceptance criteria:
- .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/epic.md
- .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/story.md
- .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/task.md
- .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug.md
- Optional config.yml that shows these templates in the new-issue chooser
